displaytitle: Costume study for Bishop Fisher and Queen Mary: for The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer
medium: Graphite, covered with light brown wash
creditline: Gift of George L. Small, Class of 1943
inscribed:
in graphite, upper right: Holbein
in graphite, center right: Dress of Bishop Fisher
in graphite, center: Houbraken
in graphite, center left: Shoe of Sommers | King Henry's Jester
in graphite, center right: 1555| Queen Mary
in graphite, lower center: look to my miniature Queen Mary & compare | it to proof in B.M: English Portraits Vol 1 | No 245 | for Cranmer's Portrait in the B.M: Vid. Walpole Anext 4 edit p495 | Gerlach or Gerlachus Fliccius
signed: Signed and dated in graphite, lower left: GH July 7. 52

titles.title: Costume Studies: Bishop Fisher and Queen Mary

Album containing 99 original drawings and 87 architecture, portrait, and costume studies of a documentary nature for the paintings Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross and The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer.

makers.displaymaker: Sir George Hayter, 1792–1871; born and died London, England

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1984," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 44, no. 1 (1985): p. 24-52.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1984," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 44, no. 1 (1985): p. 24-52., p. 33

bibliography.boilertext: "Sir George Hayter, "Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross" and "The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer": paintings and related studies in the collection of the Art Museum," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 53, no. 1 (1994): p. 36-45.
bibliography.citation: "Sir George Hayter, "Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross" and "The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer": paintings and related studies in the collection of the Art Museum," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 53, no. 1 (1994): p. 36-45., p. 42
